Description: Dome-shaped weight carved from black hard stone, likely basalt; uncarinated dome type; of ball shape, with flat base and convex top; smoothed surface; complete.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Oriental Institute, University of Chicago. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Ball-shaped weights with a flat base are very close to the dome-shaped ones and form the same category of weights for Cour-Marty (Cour-Marty 1990, 25, fig. 5). Often made out of igneous rock such as basalt and diorite – which is the case for this specimen, they do also occur in copper alloy. They are very common weights at Naukratis (Petrie 1886, pl. XXIII, “dome” type), and elsewhere in Egypt (Cour-Marty 1990, 25, fig. 13). Already present in the Old Kingdom, this type is particularly common on Late Period sites in the Delta (Cour-Marty 1990, 25, fig. 26). These weights are more often associated to the Egyptian standard deben-kedet (usually around 90-95 g and 9-9,5 g for this type) and their multiples or sub-multiples; however a lighter unit, around 8g, is also noticed and could correspond to other standards such as the Near Eastern shekel or the Greek stater (Cour-Marty 1990, p. 24-25, fig. 22-24; Kroll 2003, 317; van Alfen 2002, 184, n. 654). This specimen corresponds to 5 kedets. Cour-Marty, M.-A. 1989. Les poids dans l’Égypte ancienne, Vols. 1-3 [unpublished thesis, microform], Paris. Cour-Marty, M.-A. 1990, 'Les poids égyptiens, de précieux jalons archéologiques', Cahier de Recherches de l'Institut de Papyrologie et d'Egyptologie de Lille 12, 17-55. Kroll, J. H. 2003. ‘Weights, bullion, currency, coinage’, in N. Ch. Stampolidis and V. Karageorghis (eds), Ploes. Sea Routes… Interconnections in the Mediterranean, c. 1600-600 BC, Procedings of the International Symposium held in Rethymnon, Crete September 29th-October 2, 2002, Athens, 313-323. Petrie, W.M.F. 1886, Naukratis. Part I., 1884–5 (third memoir of the Egypt Exploration Fund), London. Petrie, W. M. F. 1926, Ancient Weights and Measures Illustrated by the Egyptian Collection in University College, London. van Alfen, P. G. 2002, Pant’agatha: Commodities in Levantine-Aegean Trade during the Persian Period, 6-4th c. B.C., PhD dissertation, The University of Texas at Austin.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (VA.421) (phase 3)
